summary: the human species is vulnerable to zoonotic infection with new influenza viruses, with the last occurring as recently as 2009. the complexity and interconnectivity of our society create vulnerabilities. pandemics with even low mortality have the potential to cause widespread suffering and economic disruption. a mammalian species (1, 2). GOF experiments were performed because there was debate in the field as to whether H5N1 could become transmissible in humans. in this particular experiment, the GOF was the acquisition of mammalian transmissibility for a virus that previously lacked it. the debate over this type of experimentation resulted in a temporary moratorium on GOF experiments involving HPAIV. mBio has provided a forum for discussion and debate on the merits of this work. mBio has provided a forum for discussion and debate on the merits of this work.
